Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of the corruption investigation by stating it is a "$60 billion" investigation, which lacks enough support.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters in providing accurate information by implying that Governor Jerry Brown is a subject of the corruption investigation when there is no evidence to support this.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to substantiate the "$60 billion corruption investigation" as it only cites unrelated news reports about a different investigation initiated by Governor Brown.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Governor Jerry Brown is directly involved in the corruption investigation without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of alternative explanation bias in the provided claim.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Governor Jerry Brown is not a subject of the corruption investigation, as confirmed by the Sacramento Bee, Los Angeles Times, and Snopes.com.
